page.title: 04TROUT FARMING
page.content: {TROUT FARMING The fish farm was established in 1978. Every year 250000 young Canadian rainbow trout are reared in 5 pools. These trout grow twice as fast as the native brown trout and one and a half tons are sold each week.In the winter a 24hr watch is kept for ice forming because flowing water contains more oxygen.A fishing loch is stocked for anglers,and visitors can buy fresh fish from the farm shop.{2)NATURE {CONSERVANCY}About 1225 acres of pine forest and 14000 acres of high hill and moorland form part of the Cairngorm Nature Reserve,created to conserve the wild life of the mountains.{3)FORESTRY }There are 7450 acres of forestry on the estate,which contains one of the few remaining areas of naturally regenerating Caledonian pine forest in Britain.
